case_vignette: A 65-YEAR-OLD ASIAN WOMAN COMES TO THE PHYSICIAN FOR A ROUTINE HEALTH MAINTENANCE EXAMINATION. ON QUESTIONING, SHE HAS HAD OCCASIONAL NIGHT SWEATS DURING THE PAST 2 MONTHS. SHE HAS NOT HAD FEVERS OR WEIGHT LOSS. SEVEN MONTHS AGO, SHE HAD AN ACUTE MYOCARDIAL INFARCTION AND WAS TREATED WITH PERCUTANEOUS CORONARY INTERVENTION. SHE HAS HYPERTENSION, HYPERLIPIDEMIA, AND GASTROESOPHAGEAL REFLUX DISEASE. SHE HAS SMOKED ONE PACK OF CIGARETTES DAILY FOR 37 YEARS. CURRENT MEDICATIONS INCLUDE ASPIRIN, ATORVASTATIN, RAMIPRIL, METOPROLOL, AND ESOMEPRAZOLE. SHE IS 178 CM (5 FT 10 IN) TALL AND WEIGHS 89 KG (207 LBS); BMI IS 29.7 KG/M2. HER TEMPERATURE IS 37.4°C (99.3°F), PULSE IS 84/MIN, RESPIRATIONS ARE 18/MIN, AND BLOOD PRESSURE IS 145/80 MM HG. THE LUNGS ARE CLEAR TO AUSCULTATION. CARDIAC EXAMINATION SHOWS AN S4. THERE IS A NONTENDER SKIN LESION NEAR THE RIGHT LARGE TOENAIL. A PHOTOGRAPH OF THE LESION IS SHOWN. THE REMAINDER OF THE EXAMINATION SHOWS NO ABNORMALITIES.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

I have been experiencing occasional night sweats during the past 2 months.
Have you noticed any changes in your skin, like new rashes or lesions?
Yes, there is a nontender skin lesion near my right large toenail.
Can you describe the appearance of the lesion?
I'm sorry, but I can only tell you that it is a skin lesion near my right large toenail; I can't describe its appearance in detail.
Have you noticed any changes in the color, shape, or size of the lesion since it first appeared?
No, I have not noticed any changes in the color, shape, or size of the lesion since it first appeared.
Do you have any history of skin cancer in your family?
I haven't mentioned anything about my family's medical history, including skin cancer.
Are you currently taking any medications or have you recently completed any treatments?
Yes, I am currently taking aspirin, atorvastatin, ramipril, metoprolol, and esomeprazole.
Do you have any other medical conditions or a history of other diseases?
Yes, I have hypertension, hyperlipidemia, gastroesophageal reflux disease, and I had a heart attack seven months ago.
Final Diagnosis: Subungual melanoma
